newsitem.title: USA: Florida pilot survives landing on market rooftop.
newsitem.headline: Florida pilot survives landing on market rooftop.

text.p: A Florida pilot whose light plane developed engine trouble on Tuesday landed it on the roof of a supermarket and was able to walk away unhurt, a police spokesman said.
Raymond McClelland suffered only a minor cut on his knee and no one else was hurt but the airplane was destroyed and the store roof was damaged.

McClelland, 52, of Venice, Florida, was trying to reach a Venice airport when the single-engine Cessna lost oil pressure. He crash-landed the plane on the Publix supermarket roof about a mile (1.6 km) short of the runway, police said.

Sarasota Sheriff's Department spokesman Cpl. Tim Carney said the plane skidded across the roof and hit the inside of a three-foot (metre)-high parapet around it. "He may have chosen the roof of a Publix supermarket because it was a large open space with no pedestrians," Carney said.
A shopper was treated for minor breathing problems after the store was hastily evacuated when fuel leaked onto the roof.
